file_content.text: I don't think Risha's going to like you keeping me so close.
Tell the truth, Captain. Is this about Ozzik's fleet, or just an excuse to see me again?
This is a business arrangement, nothing more.
It's about the fleet.
Fine. If that's the way it is, just fine!
No way am I working for you.
I don't mind working for you, Captain. But I'll jump ship the minute you ask me to go against what I believe in.
I don't know what a guy like you sees in a girl like Risha.
I liked you back when you were just a charming rogue. I never thought you'd turn into a real Republic hero.
You and Risha seem like a good match. As long as neither of you expects to be number one on the other's list.
I wasn't sure I'd ever see you again. But I can't say I'm sorry you turned up here.
What do you say we find somewhere a bit more private? Catch up a little?
We'll always have Taris.
Sorry, Beryl. It won't work.
Then, maybe we should just hold onto the memories. Here's looking at you.
Did you invite the Voidwolf here just so I'd come rescue you?
[Flirt] I've missed you.
Maybe I should have thought of that. I've been wondering where you went off to.
Her? Seriously? Ugh! I'm leaving.
I've got to hand it to you, Captain. You've got a way with the ladies. I'll be at the ship.
I want no part of this. I'll wait outside.
Alone at last....
I never expected this to be the answer.
I'll see you at Port Nowhere, Captain. Put aside a bottle of your best.
Next time I need a rescue, I'll know who to call.
I'm not really here to chat.
I've got things to do.
I understand. No strings and all that. Be well, Captain.
Thanks. But don't expect me to trust you.
It was good to work with you again, Captain. Best of luck.
I'll come to Port Nowhere as soon as we clear the Voidwolf's fleet.
Thanks for your service, Captain.
I've sent my first ship out undetected. Looks like you really took their system down.
I learned on Taris, always assume she can do anything she promises.
Doesn't surprise me. Not after Taris. He's better than he looks.
I guess I owe you, then, Captain. What can we do for you? Once we've delivered these medicines to Skustell, that is.
Let's have the payment first. Then you go where you like.
I like cash-in-hand.
Mercenary to the end.
You don't like to be tied down, do you, Captain? Not even by favors owed.
Then I'll make the transfer right now, and count myself lucky for the loss.
You've been straight up with me, Captain. I'll be sure to add that to the stories floatin' around about you.
You keep supporting the Republic, and you don't owe me anything.
We're on the same side.
Is that why you turned me in? Patriotism?
It's cute watching you be noble. Like I just met your good twin brother.
Since when are you a patriot?
When you see what the Empire does, it takes a hard heart not to turn patriot.
But it doesn't feel right to let you leave empty-handed. Call this my way of saying thanks.
And I'll make sure your good deeds make it into the name you're building for yourself.
Report to Darmas Pollaran at Port Nowhere. He'll give you my first assignment.
You work for me now.
Oh, no. This is where I get off.
Work for you, huh? What exactly are your policies on office romances?
But what about the refugees?
We're doing important work here. Without the medicine we bring, thousands of Republic freedom fighters could....
Never mind. I can see it's futile to appeal to your better nature. I won't go back on my word.
My fleet will serve you long enough to pay off this debt... then pray it's not too late to still affect this war.
Good day, Captain.
The Planetary Sensor Station--until that's down, we're stuck here.
She's here! The captain made it. Ready the ships, men. We may have a chance after all.
He's here! The captain's here! Ready the ships, we're getting off this sinkhole!
Get us out of here, and everything you see is yours for the taking.
Good. I don't visit Imperial-occupied war zones just for fun.
That's why I'm here.
Yet somehow you end up in quite a lot of them.
I love a man who's not afraid to beg. Do you swoon too?
[Flirt] Ask nicely.
I can swoon. You never asked me to swoon.
Only when a beautiful lady spacer braves the Voidwolf's collar to rescue me.
Let's go.
You've had more time to work on this than I have--what's our best strategy?
You got a plan?
Well, look who the rakghoul dragged in....
Do you two know each other?
Oh, yes. The captain does love his heroic rescues. Without his gallantry, I'd be stuck in a Taris prison cell right now.
Oh, really? You left that part out of the story, love-bug.
Uh-oh. Does that mean--? Ha. One time, sister, I got there first, and there's nothing you can do about it!
Girls, girls... there's plenty of me to go around.
You don't need to fight.
You try that line one more time, you'll be wrapped around the front of my blaster.
When we were on Taris, you still hated me!
This was ages ago.
What an excellent policy!
Don't worry. I'm long past taking your leftovers, Risha. You can have him.
You don't own me.
Back off, Risha.
Yeah, but if you two are still traveling together, I'd say she's got squatter's rights.
Take him and welcome to it, Risha.
We'll see.
Not to break up the catfight, but we've got the Voidwolf breathing down our backs here.
Without the captain's help, I'd be in a Taris prison cell right now.
A bit of a surprise, given the company you keep.
It wasn't our lives on the line that time. I never apologize for saving myself.
Oh, yes. From what Agent Soganti said, it was the captain's testimony that got me jailed on Taris as a suspected antiquities thief.
I should have figured as much, given the company you keep.
It looks like you managed to bribe your way out before you served too much time. You're getting good at that.
Yes, I'm out. Not that either of you spared me a thought once you left Taris!
You'll be glad to hear I scraped together the bribe he wanted and escaped my sentence. I'm sure you were worried.
I didn't want to jeopardize my mission on Taris. Besides, I knew you'd manage to get out of it.
That was a misunderstanding....
I'm sure that was it.
You want to be rescued or not?
Don't start with me.
What's option "C"?
I'll talk with her later. Thank you for coming, Captain.
I've never turned against anyone I've worked with.
[Lie] She's a liar.
If there was a single other ship in the galaxy who might find us here....
But there isn't. So, whatever your motivations, Captain, I'm glad you're here now.
Well, I'm glad to be privy to the grand reunion, but we've got more urgent concerns.
The Voidwolf's been using a powerful Planetary Sensor Station to "tag" any ships leaving Quesh's surface. Then his fleet homes in and "boom."
The only way off is to destroy the station's sensor processors.
I find I'm much better at destroying things than preserving them....
Deal.
It's so rare to find a man who admits that.
I'm on my way.
The Voidwolf's men are everywhere. And they're only some of the Imperial troops on this planet.
I'll give you the details, but this is definitely the place for "shoot first, ask questions later."
Don't even think about going back on that offer, or I'll take you to the Voidwolf myself.
And then you work for me.
Lighten up. Ozzik's good people. You've got my word.
Just because you don't hesitate to double-cross an ally, doesn't mean everyone's made that way.
We've been trapped for weeks, and you're the first one to respond. If you can do this, I understand how much I owe you.
Just come back quickly when it's done. I don't want to be here when the Voidwolf retaliates.
Who is this?
Captain Ozzik here. Die, you scum! Republic privateer--duck! We're on the same side.
Get that hangar sealed!
...too many... still trapped outside....
Then cut them off! It's them or us.
Sorry, Captain. We're under heavy fire. The Voidwolf. Without an immediate assist, we're gonna be red smears on the sidewalk.
I don't risk my life for strangers... but I find credits are a great way to make friends.
Are you making an offer?
It sounds like you don't have much time.
Just tell me where to go.
Let the Republic bail you out.
This isn't my problem.
I'm a deniable asset, just like you. Gotta make my own deals.
Get us out of here intact, and my whole fleet's yours--however long you need it.
All right. The hangar's sealed. That should buy us a few hours.
Get the injured to the back. Medpacs are running low, so head and torso shots first.
We're underground now, but the Voidwolf's got patrols all over Quesh. It's only a matter of time before they smoke us out.
Where's Quesh? You want my help, give me a direction.
I need a location.
I'm transmitting coordinates now. Quesh is a swamp world, newly discovered, produces a lot of adrenals and combat mods.
I've been running them to Republic freedom fighters in the Outer Rim. Apparently, the Voidwolf didn't like me evening the odds.
Give me some idea of what I'm walking into.
Why's the Voidwolf after you?
I've been running adrenals and combat mods from Quesh to Republic freedom fighters in the Outer Rim. The Voidwolf took offense.
Sorry. I'm busy.
Captain! If this guy's a privateer, don't we owe him? Who'll bail us out if things go south?
Corso's right. If he's legit, we make a new friend. If it's a trap, we make sure we spring it wisely.
No trap. We're both fighting the Voidwolf, Captain. He targeted me for running combat mods from Quesh to Republic freedom fighters.
He's got some kind of turbolaser barrage. Took down two ships, one shot each. I haven't gotten a launch off since.
The whole planet's under an Imperial invasion.
Come soon. I don't think we can hold out long.
How'd you get in here? There's Imperials everywhere.
Excuse me.
